definition: farmstead/village/manor/place of business/banker (in a gambling game)/grave or solemn/holdings of a landlord (in imperial China)

sentences.english: At that time making it to a mess and confused farmer can not farm.
sentences.chinese: 那時節令很亂，弄得莊稼人無法種田。

sentences.english: She said it was having planters' hands that knew how to do it.
sentences.chinese: 她說是因爲有了莊稼人的手才知道怎麼去種植。

sentences.english: In croppy culture, common parlance is turned on its head.
sentences.chinese: 在莊稼人文化中，某些說法的通常含義完全改變了。

sentences.english: At the age of ten, Fantine quitted the town and went to service with some farmers in the neighborhood.
sentences.chinese: 十歲上，芳汀出城到附近的莊稼人家裏去作工。

sentences.english: He is a small farmer a very poor farm er barely making a living.
sentences.chinese: 他是個小農戶，很窮的莊稼人，勉強維持生計。

sentences.english: The lure of the big city is very attractive to people from rural areas.
sentences.chinese: 對莊稼人來說，大都市的誘惑是非常吸引人的。

sentences.english: Those are hemp seeds he is sowing;
sentences.chinese: 一個莊稼人正在地裏播種大麻的種子。
他是一個淳樸的莊稼人。

sentences.english: The peasants tried to make every cent do the work of two.
sentences.chinese: 莊稼人恨不得把一分錢掰成兩半使。

sentences.english: Bai thought, "The hometown is poor because people have no knowledge."
sentences.chinese: 他想，家鄉那麼貧困，正是因爲莊稼人沒文化。
